meanings.definition: To make something appear kitschy or tacky in style or appearance.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys kitschifying her room with bright colors and quirky decorations.
meanings.sent2: The artist is kitschifying the painting by adding glitter and plastic flowers.
meanings.sent3: The party planner went a bit overboard with kitschifying the event, but everyone had fun.
meanings.sent4: The fashion designer is kitschifying the runway with retro-inspired outfits and bold patterns.
meanings.sent5: By kitschifying the old furniture, she gave her home a unique and playful look.

meanings.definition: The act of adding kitsch or tacky elements to something.
meanings.sent1: The kitschifying of the room was evident with the neon signs and velvet paintings.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't resist the kitschifying of her outfit with oversized sunglasses and a feather boa.
meanings.sent3: The kitschifying of the office space brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: His kitschifying of the car interior made it stand out in the parking lot.
meanings.sent5: The kitschifying of the garden with gnome statues and pink flamingos created a whimsical atmosphere.
